Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as year 10 wine of the Aten domain.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 11
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393166) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393166)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
